meanings.definition: The quality of being adapted for seizing or grasping
meanings.sent1: The monkey's prehensility allowed it to grab the banana easily.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel's prehensility helped it hold onto the tree branch tightly.
meanings.sent3: The octopus showed off its prehensility by juggling colorful balls.
meanings.sent4: Her prehensility in art class was like a paintbrush dancing on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The robot's prehensility was so precise, it could pick up tiny screws effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The ability to grasp or hold objects with the hands or feet
meanings.sent1: The baby's prehensility developed as it learned to pick up toys.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's prehensility was evident as it played with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent3: The clown's prehensility was put to the test when juggling rubber chickens.
meanings.sent4: His prehensility in basketball made him a master at dribbling and shooting.
meanings.sent5: The tree frog's prehensility allowed it to cling to the slippery leaf without slipping.
